data.title: Great place
data.text:
Came to High Point to visit my dad and they had a great deal going on (better than staying in a motel six or super 8) and I stayed here before years before, had a few issues before but the hotel fixed them each time. 

I requested a king room facing downtown. There is a large huge window to look out of. 

Bed was pretty comfortable and the chair in the room was squishy, so a plus. A nice deep tub for a soak in the bathtub. 

There is a pool, a bar, fitness room, and parking garage. The parking pass for there is 6 dollars. 

The bar was empty, which is a shame because the food is good (I've never had a better quesadilla) and the service was friendly. The bartender wished it could be busier because she said most nights (this was a Saturday night too-not good) she stands by the window to watch the cars go by. 

The room was super quiet and we barely heard anyone or the outside life.

Over all though, I'd stay here again for sure.

data.title: Wish it weren't so.
data.text: Stayed there recently for 4 days for a wedding and look around the area.  We got in late, after 12 AM Thursday, and cleaned ourselves up from a long 7 hour trip.  The next day, Friday, we could not get room service to give us more towels or straighten up the room.  We called the desk twice for fresh towels, nothing came.  Finally we went to the desk and later that evening towels did arrive, but no housekeeping.  The hotel was fully booked and the furniture convention had just left town, but it truly seemed there was a lack of staff.  To top it off, we found out that the hotel had booked what was kindly called a leather convention, but after some inquiries, we found out it was a fetish convention.  To each their own, but there were many children in the hotel for several local weddings. IMO the hotel could have given us some warning that this type of convention was being held there, but then we would probably have moved our group.  Very surprising to see people in full head leather masks with devil horns in the lobby late in the evening.  The room was sufficient but dated.  Bed was comfortable, A/C worked for the most part.  TV has minimal stations.  Tub surround had some black mold in the corners.  Booked rooms were changed and our group was split over multiple floors without our knowledge.  A handicapped relative who booked a handicapped room far in advance did not have a handicapped room when she arrived, but hotel did resolve this.  Be warned.

data.title: OMG this is a Radisson?
data.text:
We are all the type to make due and have fun no matter where we are AND we did, but I was very disappointed in this hotel. We were there for a wedding. I believe are group had 30 + rooms & a little less than half were not happy. We had ants & hair on our bathroom floor. One of our family members had a suite. When you walked in their room it smelled awful of what was like cat urine (it was coming out of the vents when the air kicked in). Couple of rooms - no toilet paper. Another room - bathroom sink the water kept running. Other rooms - complaints of unclean bathrooms. That was just the rooms. 
The elevator was filthy & at one point did not work.
The Bistro Bar - after our rehearsal dinner we went back to the bar - one bartender. Now we were not the only event going on. There was two or three weddings & an additional event. The hotel was not at all prepared.
Parking - you had to pay for parking - what???? Your paying to stay there & they charge for parking. This is High Point not a huge city. Other than when we stayed in Downtown Chicago, IL (which I expected) we have never paid for hotel parking.
The one good thing I can say is that the Bistro food was pretty good.
All in all this Radisson definitely gives other Radisson's a bad name.
We had a fantastic time & that's what matters, but this place needs help not to mention a whole new cleaning staff!!!!!!

data.title: Great hotel, great deal
data.text: We got a flash-sale on room and it was a great deal for a great hotel.  The room was very clean, pool was excellent and very warm.  I miss having breakfasts at hotels as so many offer that and Radisson does not. The hotel needs a microwave available for guest use but rooms do have refrigerators. They charge $6/night for parking but I was able to easily find street parking for free right outside the door. I'd definitely stay again.

data.title: Nice place for a quick stay
data.text: Very nice location, a bit scary at night as it appeared to be a ghost town.  Don't think to bring outside food into the bar if you are hungry, you'll be told to go elsewhere to eat it.  Over all it was a nice stay for a short time.

data.title: Old world charm and grace.
data.text: This place surprised me and we had an incredible time. Best people and the food was great!  Really enjoyed the whole resort. The pool was nice an relaxing. Great place to go for some peace and quiet.  Make sure to walk around the local area and explore the great Military History and quirky Americana.

data.title: Perfect Location
data.text: I love, love love the location, it is in the heart of the High Point Furniture Market. The staff is not friendly every thing seemed to be an inconvenience to the ladies at the desk. At the time I checked into my room there was no toilet paper and the shower would not drain. Both issues were addressed fairly quickly though the shower drain was still extremely slow. I will always try to stay at the Radisson because this hotel is the best location, it is the place to stay when going to market.

data.title: Save your money
data.text: The décor in the hotel is very old.  It is in major need of restoration.  The carpeting is stained and discolored.  The wallpaper is old and many scuffed marks along the walls.  The furniture in our room was banged up with strips of the wood covering torn off.  The shower rod in our room was broken so the shower curtain would not stay closed and kept falling towards the middle, thus allowing water to fall onto the floor.  The toilet paper roll holder squeaked so loudly we used tissues so we didn't have to listen to the squeak.  The interior of both the garage and hotel elevators are in great need of updating.  The room we were assigned when we first arrived still had someone in it.  When we opened the door, the TV was on, clothes were still hanging in the closet.  We immediately went back to the front desk and was assigned another room.  We paid $41.00 for breakfast that should have been complimentary.  No offense, but we ate breakfast at McDonald's on our 2nd day there due to it was $30.00 cheaper and the food at McDonald's was better.  We didn't have to pay for parking.  Not sure if parking was included in the price of the room, but it was nice to not have to pay for parking each time we left the garage.

data.title: Hotel is Nice but MAKE RESERVATIONS IN PERSON OR BY PHONE
data.text: My wedding was held at a High Point venue and I knew I would have family from out of state coming to attend. I contacted the Radisson in High Point about group rates and was directed to Nikki. She said that she would set up a room block for my family, half king rooms and half doubles, at a reduced rate of $109. For myself, she would book one of their one bedroom suites which included a parlor for $163.  First, every family member that tried to book one of our rooms had trouble. Some were told that the rooms were not available, even right after we arranged for the room block. Some were not given the discount, others were told they could not have king beds even though we still had some in our block.  When my family started checking in things only got worse. Check in took forever. Some family members had to change rooms during the weekend because of overbooking. I had arranged to stay at the hotel the night before and the night of my wedding. When I checked in I was informed that my reservation was only for the parlor side of the suite, not the entire room, meaning NO BED! This was the night before my wedding. I will say that the front desk staff was very patient and nice, even when dealing with an over emotional bride to be and her mother. They were able to find me a king size room and I could move to the suite the next day once it was vacated and turned over. But then I found out that I would be charged the room rate of the king size room, because it was a business class room this a lot of money. They were able to reduce the rate by 50%, but by this time I was in tears, the night before my wedding.  The next day I had to decorate the venue, I made sure that my new room would be ready at 12:30 when I was due back, so that I had time to shower before hair and make-up. It was not. I was told I could go back to my original room to shower, so I go upstairs, but my luggage had already been removed. I went back to the front desk and was directed to suite where I had to wait in the parlor while housekeeping cleaned the bathroom so that I could shower.  The day after the wedding, my parents had arranged for us to host a farewell brunch in a meeting room. The hotel "Catering" was exactly what we had eaten in the breakfast buffet all weekend. While it was a very nice set up, I think this could have been taken up a notch.  I am still waiting on an almost $200 refund for not staying in the suite for a night, honestly the whole stay should have been comped as it was a complete nightmare!  I want to say again that all of the staff we dealt with in person was VERY helpful, understanding and informative. But there is a SERIOUS disconnect with reservations and whoever set up room blocks and suite arrangements.

data.title: Family stay
data.text: Came in for a family wedding.   The hotel was very busy but the check in personnel (Kim) was wonderful. Most of my family stayed at this hotel.  We would have liked to have been able to watch Sunday football in the bar area

data.title: Needs to be updated
data.text: Hotel has a great location and we was here A&T homecoming.  There were no other hotels available so we chose to stay here.  Needs to change carpet and the coffee maker didn't work.  It may be nice for someone else, just not me.  I would choose Starwood or marriott

data.title: Be aware at check in
data.text: We booked our night for our son's soccer showcase, check in went fine, made it to our room, not long after we were ready to relax, the door came open, a lady and her daughter were walking into our room they have been given the same room as us, in this crazy world we live this is unacceptable and unsafe, the issue was resolve but this should not happen on a hotel that stands above others, this a safety issue that needs not to be taken lightly.

data.title: Great location but overpriced.
data.text: I was there for the furniture market.  Great location and beds were very comfy and staff was great,however,  restaurant food had a lot to be desired and the carpeting needs to be replaced.  Overpriced for what it is.

data.title: Shabby (yes) Chic (NO)
data.text: The High Point Radisson is the least likely hotel you would find in the furniture 'style' capital of the world. It is very run down. The POSITIVE: it doesn't smell as bad as it looks. At over $330/night, one would expect an updated chic hotel - with decent service in the lounge and restaurant.

owner_response.author: CarlsonRezidor, ONline Customer Care at Radisson Hotel High Point, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback.  We take pride in our “Yes I Can!” culture and do apologize you did not receive this level of service.  We take the time to listen to your constructive comments, so we can continually improve our services.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Friendly old Radisson
data.text: This hotel is adjacent to the High Point Furniture Market buildings and is the most convenient place to stay every April and October during the furniture show, by far. The hotel itself is older and could use some refurbishing but it is clean and well maintained and the staff is very friendly and helpful.

data.title: Highpoint Market Stay
data.text: This hotel is so dated and awful.  I was in shock.  Paid $360.00 a night because of location to High Point Market downtown.  You have to book 6 months out.  If you have ANY changed to your reservation after THIRTY days you are charged in full.  I HAD to get back to AZ a day earlier than planned and had to pay the whole last night.  NO DISCUSSION!  They have not bothered to update this hotel.  The food in restaurant is all frozen and cooked.  So disappointed.  Terrible wines in the bar as well.  What a dump.  I LOVED being able to walk to everything at my market.  THE ONLY BONUS is the location.  There was mold growing in the hallways, peeling wallpaper, stinky, Our room didn't get cleaned one day, second day she made beds, left all dirty hot tea mugs, paper cups, where they were and didn't empty our trash cans.

owner_response.author: CarlsonRezidor, Online customer support at Radisson Hotel High Point, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback.  We take pride in our “Yes I Can!” culture and do apologize you did not receive this level of service.  We take the time to listen to your constructive comments, so we can continually improve our services with housekeeping and with our restaurant food.  We hope for another opportunity to exceed your expectations.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Parents Weekend - It sells out - It's just OK - but if other hotels are sold out
data.text:
Staff were friendly and accommodating.  Just a few minutes drive from HPU.  It was filled with HPU families on Family Weekend.  It's old and needs an update.  But it was doable for us.  The first room they provided us smelled musty.  I called and they changed our room.  They had just sprayed something in the second room (it was heavy in the air) to get rid of the musty smell.  Hahaha as if we wouldn't notice.  We figure they might all have that musty smell.  

This hotel definitely needs updating.  When it's move in or Family Weekend and the other good hotels in the area are sold out, then if you can still get a room in this one, then we do it.  We know others who hate this hotel, so it depends.  If you need everything perfect, this is not the place.  

After a long day with our children, there are many HPU parents at the bar at night on family weekend.  You also run into them at the breakfast here in the morning.

One of the two elevators broke while we were there.  Everyone was patient.  But it goes to show, this is an old hotel in need of a renovation.

data.title: Not the place of choice to stay
data.text: Hotel is in the center of the city, not a great place to be.  Lobby was nice and clean but the 2nd floor were we stayed was old, dirty and stained carpet and although the room looked ok, the carpet turned out to be filthy.

owner_response.author: CarlsonRezidor, Online customer support at Radisson Hotel High Point, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for reaching out and writing your review.  We are sorry you were not satisfied with the accommodations of your room and that the carpets were dirty.  We will review the conditions of your room with our housekeeping staff to ensure all guest rooms are up to Radisson Hotels standards.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Wonderful Staff and Hotel
data.text: We come for The High Point Market, which is extremely busy time for the hotel which is fully booked. The staff are warm and inviting and make you feel special. we have stay at this hotel over 10 times and have never had a problem, and any requested are done quickly and staff make sure that we received whatever we asked for. This trip my mother needed extra pillows and blankets we had them within 15 minutes. House keeping came by to make sure we had enough towels; service here is great. I would recommend this hotel.

data.title: Love the commute
data.text: The hotel offers the best proximity to Market.  It is clean and the beds are fresh and comfortable.  Since this was a business trip and I am not in the room a lot, I will stay there again in the future.
